info.description: Various APIs for interacting with Stroom and its data
info.title: Stroom API

delete.summary: Clear all buffers currently available in the buffer pool to reclaim memory. Performed on the named node or all nodes if null.

get.description: This is primarily intended  for small scale debugging in non-production environments. If no limit is set a default limit is applied else the results will be limited to limit entries.
get.summary: List entries from the reference data store on the node called.

post.summary: Perform a reference data lookup using the supplied lookup request. Reference data will be loaded if required using the supplied reference pipeline. Performed on this node only.

delete.summary: Explicitly delete all entries that are older than purgeAge. Performed on the named node, or all nodes if null.
Delete all entries for a reference stream. Performed on the named node or all nodes if null.

get.description: This is primarily intended  for small scale debugging in non-production environments. If no limit is set a default limit is applied else the results will be limited to limit entries. Performed on this node only.

componentId.description: The ID of the component that will receive the results corresponding to this ResultRequest

pattern.description: A date time formatting pattern string conforming to the specification of java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter

usePreferences.description: Choose if you want to use the user preference to determine the date/time format

DateTimeFormatSettings.description: The string formatting to apply to a date value

dateTimePattern.description: A date time formatting pattern string conforming to the specification of java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter

localZoneId.description: The local zone id to use when formatting date values in the search results. The value is the string form of a java.time.ZoneId

DocRef.description: A class for describing a unique reference to a 'document' in stroom.  A 'document' is an entity in stroom such as a data source dictionary or pipeline.

name.description: The name for the data source

type.description: The type of the 'document' that this DocRef refers to

ExpressionItem.description: Base type for an item in an expression tree

enabled.description: Whether this item in the expression tree is enabled or not

ExpressionOperator.description: A logical addOperator term in a query expression tree

enabled.description: Whether this item in the expression tree is enabled or not

condition.description: The condition of the predicate term

field.description: The name of the field that is being evaluated in this predicate term

value.description: The value that the field value is being evaluated against. Not required if a dictionary is supplied

ExpressionTerm.description: A predicate term in a query expression tree

Field.description: Describes a field in a result set. The field can have various expressions applied to it, e.g. SUM(), along with sorting, filtering, formatting and grouping

expression.description: The expression to use to generate the value for this field

Filter.description: A pair of regular expression filters (inclusion and exclusion) to apply to the field.  Either or both can be supplied

excludes.description: Only results NOT matching this filter will be included

includes.description: Only results matching this filter will be included

FlatResult.description: A result structure used primarily for visualisation data

Format.description: Describes the formatting that will be applied to values in a field

enum: 406 - 110 - Feed is not set to receive data

useSeparator.description: Whether to use a thousands separator or not. Defaults to false

NumberFormatSettings.description: The definition of a format to apply to numeric data

OffsetRange.description: The offset and length of a range of data in a sub-set of a query result set

length.description: The length in records of the sub-set of results

offset.description: The start offset for this sub-set of data, where zero is the offset of the first record in the full result set

PageResponse.description: Details of the page of results being returned.

Param.description: A key value pair that describes a property of a query

Query.description: The query terms for the search

QueryKey.description: A unique key to identify the instance of the search by. This key is used to identify multiple requests for the same search when running in incremental mode.

uuid.description: The UUID that makes up the query key

Result.description: Base object for describing a set of result data

componentId.description: The ID of the component that this result set was requested for. See ResultRequest in SearchRequest

error.description: If an error has occurred producing this result set then this will have details of the error

ResultRequest.description: A definition for how to return the raw results of the query in the SearchResponse, e.g. sorted, grouped, limited, etc.

componentId.description: The ID of the component that will receive the results corresponding to this ResultRequest

resultStyle.description: The style of results required. FLAT will provide a FlatResult object, while TABLE will provide a TableResult object

Row.description: A row of data in a result set

depth.description: The grouping depth, where 0 is the top level of grouping, or where there is no grouping

values.description: The value for this row of data. The values in the list are in the same order as the fields in the ResultRequest

items.description: The value for this row of data. The values in the list are in the same order as the fields in the ResultRequest

SearchRequest.description: A request for new search or a follow up request for more data for an existing iterative search

incremental.description: If true the response will contain all results found so far, typically no results on the first request. Future requests for the same query key may return more results. Intended for use on longer running searches to allow partial result sets to be returned as soon as they are available rather than waiting for the full result set.

timeout.description: Set the maximum time (in ms) for the server to wait for a complete result set. The timeout applies to both incremental and non incremental queries, though the behaviour is slightly different. The timeout will make the server wait for which ever comes first out of the query completing or the timeout period being reached. If no value is supplied then for an incremental query a default value of 0 will be used (i.e. returning immediately) and for a non-incremental query the server's default timeout period will be used. For an incremental query, if the query has not completed by the end of the timeout period, it will return the currently know results with complete=false, however for a non-incremental query it will return no results, complete=false and details of the timeout in the error field

SearchResponse.description: The response to a search request, that may or may not contain results. The results may only be a partial set if an iterative screech was requested

highlights.description: A list of strings to highlight in the UI that should correlate with the search query.

items.description: A list of strings to highlight in the UI that should correlate with the search query.

Sort.description: Describes the sorting applied to a field

direction.description: The direction to sort in, ASCENDING or DESCENDING

order.description: Where multiple fields are sorted this value describes the sort order, with 0 being the first field to sort on

maxResults.description: Defines the maximum number of results to return at each grouping level, e.g. '1000,10,1' means 1000 results at group level 0, 10 at level 1 and 1 at level 2. In the absence of this field system defaults will apply

items.description: Defines the maximum number of results to return at each grouping level, e.g. '1000,10,1' means 1000 results at group level 0, 10 at level 1 and 1 at level 2. In the absence of this field system defaults will apply

TableResult.description: Object for describing a set of results in a table form that supports grouped data

TableSettings.description: An object to describe how the query results should be returned, including which fields should be included and what sorting, grouping, filtering, limiting, etc. should be applied

maxResults.description: Defines the maximum number of results to return at each grouping level, e.g. '1000,10,1' means 1000 results at group level 0, 10 at level 1 and 1 at level 2. In the absence of this field system defaults will apply

items.description: Defines the maximum number of results to return at each grouping level, e.g. '1000,10,1' means 1000 results at group level 0, 10 at level 1 and 1 at level 2. In the absence of this field system defaults will apply

showDetail.description: When grouping is used a value of true indicates that the results will include the full detail of any results aggregated into a group as well as their aggregates. A value of false will only include the aggregated values for each group. Defaults to false.

TimeZone.description: The timezone to apply to a date time value

id.description: The id of the time zone, conforming to java.time.ZoneId

offsetHours.description: The number of hours this timezone is offset from UTC

offsetMinutes.description: The number of minutes this timezone is offset from UTC

use.description: How the time zone will be specified, e.g. from provided client 'Local' time, 'UTC', a recognised timezone 'Id' or an 'Offset' from UTC in hours and minutes.

dateTimePattern.description: A date time formatting pattern string conforming to the specification of java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter
